description:
At Cohen, Blostein & Ayala, P.A., we get results. In medical malpractice and personal injury cases, our attorneys excel at advocating for people in Orlando, Florida, and throughout Broward and Miami-Dade counties. Our law firm has obtained millions of dollars on behalf of clients who have suffered the unthinkable, from a surgical mistake to a brain injury to a car accident. At the same time, we successfully defend entities against these claims. This experience on both sides of the courtroom enables us to deliver a comprehensive legal strategy no matter who our client is.

People who work with our law firm receive:

  • Free initial consultations
  • Attorneys with decades of practice
  • Efficient solutions that reduce time and resources spent
  • One-on-one attention from attorneys who care

Our attorneys have earned the respect of clients, peers and the legal community. Our accolades include being selected for inclusion in The Best Lawyers in America; holding the highest peer rating possible of AV Preeminent* from Martindale-Hubbell; being named one of Florida's Legal Elite; and receiving the America's Top 100 Attorneys' Lifetime Achievement Award.

Cohen, Blostein & Ayala, P.A., offers services in Spanish. The caseload at our law firm includes the following: medical negligence such as prescription errors, cancer malpractice, hospital mistakes and birth injuries; motor vehicle accidents such as motorcycle, golf carts, commercial vehicles, public transportation and boating accidents; defective products; elder abuse and wrongful death; and drawbridge, amusement rides and diving accidents. We also handle complex commercial litigation issues.

*AV®, AV Preeminent®, Martindale-Hubbell Distinguished and Martindale-Hubbell Notable are certification marks used under license in accordance with the Martindale-Hubbell certification procedures, standards and policies. Martindale-Hubbell® is the facilitator of a peer review rating process. Ratings reflect the anonymous opinions of members of the bar and the judiciary. Martindale-Hubbell® Peer Review RatingTM fall into two categories - legal ability and general ethical standards.
